member.name: TextRenderingHint
member.summary: The TextRenderingHint enumeration specifies the process used to render text. The process affects the quality of the text.

member.name: TextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintSystemDefault
member.summary: Specifies that a character is drawn using the currently selected system font smoothing mode (also called a rendering hint).

member.name: TextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintSingleBitPerPixelGridFit
member.summary: Specifies that a character is drawn using its glyph bitmap and hinting to improve character appearance on stems and curvature.

member.name: TextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintSingleBitPerPixel
member.summary: Specifies that a character is drawn using its glyph bitmap and no hinting. This results in better performance at the expense of quality.

member.name: TextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintAntiAliasGridFit
member.summary: Specifies that a character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap and hinting. This results in much better quality due to antialiasing at a higher performance cost.

member.name: TextRenderingHint.TextRenderingHintAntiAlias
member.summary: Specifies that a character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap and no hinting. Stem width differences may be noticeable because hinting is turned off.

summary.para: Specifies that a character is drawn using its glyph ClearType bitmap and hinting. This type of text rendering cannot be used along with .

Windows XP and Windows Server 2003 and later versions of Windows only: ClearType rendering is supported only on Windows XP and Windows Server 2003 and later versions of Windows. Therefore, is ignored on other operating systems even though GDI+ is supported on those operating systems.
